item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, October 21, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (147 points | 67 comments)
2. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (34 points | 8 comments)
3. Show HN: Epublifier – scrape pages (books, manuals) for offline reading (202 points | 33 comments)
4. Show HN: Floating point arithmetic types in C++ for any size and any base (20 points | 4 comments)
5. IOCCC Flight Simulator (2010) (122 points | 19 comments)
6. Please do not write below the line (94 points | 74 comments)
7. Software Engineering Body of Knowledge (SWEBOK) v4.0 is out [pdf] (22 points | 3 comments)
8. Microsoft is introducing hidden APIs to VS Code only enabled for Copilot (146 points | 89 comments)
9. Waking up science's sleeping beauties (2023) (45 points | 16 comments)
10. Egypt declared malaria-free after 100-year effort (366 points | 37 comments)
11. ByteDance intern fired for planting malicious code in AI models (47 points | 37 comments)
12. Morsle – A daily Morse code challenge (67 points | 19 comments)
13. Workaround Clang v15 AArch64 miscompile that affects parallel collection (4 points | 1 comment)
14. Scientists working to decode birdsong (97 points | 98 comments)
15. Plankton balloon to six times size in newly discovered mode of oceanic travel (61 points | 7 comments)
16. U.S. border surveillance towers have always been broken (79 points | 53 comments)
17. Perplexity AI's new tool for researching the stock market (36 points | 12 comments)
18. Show HN: HN Update – Hourly news broadcast of top HN stories (567 points | 167 comments)
19. Jiga (YC W21) Is Hiring a Full Stack Engineer (React/Mongo/Node) ( | hide)
20. "The Secret History of the Mongols": A digital history approach (35 points | 10 comments)
21. Turing and the Primes (2016) [pdf] (9 points | 2 comments)
22. A step toward fully 3D-printed active electronics (172 points | 70 comments)
23. Werckmeister Temperment (15 points | 11 comments)
24. Do AI detectors work? Students face false cheating accusations (376 points | 806 comments)
25. WebGPU-Based WiFi Simulator (314 points | 82 comments)
26. Making Castro’s Feeds Update Faster the Lazy Way (78 points | 27 comments)
27. Kurt Vonnegut's lost board game published (320 points | 92 comments)
28. Turning the Crank: Design as a Mechanical Process (18 points | 1 comment)
29. Can SpaceX land a rocket with 1/2 cm accuracy? (105 points | 97 comments)
30. Drasi: Microsoft's open source data processing platform for event-driven systems (315 points | 54 comments)
